channel.title: How and were do i add the ::command interface?
channel.description: how do i add it ? ive see it on other servers u type ::commands and it shows all the commands how do i do that? :confused:

item.title: How and were do i add the ::command interface?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:24, topic:260969”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=344584.msg2660313#msg2660313 date=1234137272]

Ok, fine. Listen to them. Declare a random variable called name for no reason whatsoever. That will open the interface.

Haha, sorry. I don’t know what I was doing that day…maybe something killed my brain.

On Topic: Yeah…all you need to do is call the showInterface method. (Unless someone posted that already.)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 08, 2009, 01:34:24 pm[/size][hr][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=344584.msg2658685#msg2658685 date=1234045045]
Ok, fine. Listen to them. Declare a random variable called name for no reason whatsoever. That will open the interface.

Haha, sorry. I don’t know what I was doing that day…maybe something killed my brain.

On Topic: Yeah…all you need to do is call the showInterface method, which makes a screen pop up. Then you just have to add your sendQuest lines. (Unless someone posted that already.)
[/quote]

setInterfaceWalkable, not showInterface.
[/quote]
Really?! I learned something today. :)[/quote]

It actually doesn’t matter what the name is, you can have showInterface as long as you change the setInterfaceWalkable method.

Read full topic

item.source: How and were do i add the ::command interface?

item.title: How and were do i add the ::command interface?
item.dc:creator: @joeyjoe9876 joeyjoe9876
item.description:
@joeyjoe9876 wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:16, topic:260969”]To be honest, qwerty is right. That doesn’t open an interface. Maybe you should realize what the code does before you even post.

You need to create a method that opens and interface, and then writes the sendQuests.

Example:

public void menu() { clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("Close Window", 3024);//Close Text sendQuest("", 3026);//Line 1 showInterface(3023); flushOutStream(); }[/quote]

thanx this explains more what i meant by make it open an interface.

Read full topic
item.source: How and were do i add the ::command interface?

item.title: How and were do i add the ::command interface?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

To be honest, qwerty is right. That doesn’t open an interface. Maybe you should realize what the code does before you even post.

You need to create a method that opens and interface, and then writes the sendQuests.

Example:

public void menu() { clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("Close Window", 3024);//Close Text sendQuest("", 3026);//Line 1 showInterface(3023); flushOutStream(); }

Read full topic
item.source: How and were do i add the ::command interface?

item.title: How and were do i add the ::command interface?
item.dc:creator: @joeyjoe9876 joeyjoe9876
item.description:
@joeyjoe9876 wrote:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { yourmethod(); }

then make a method named “commands” and make it open a interface with the commands you have.

be sure to add this under your customcommand method

**yourmethod(); = the name of the method you made…

Read full topic
